DataElement.preferredDefinition: Age at which each of the participant's first degree blood relatives were diagnosed with each of their cancer(s)

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: a record of a patient's family members' and ancestors' medical background related to cancer used as a basis for comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: a spoken or written statement that is made in reply to a question or request.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: values for the age when an individual was diagnosed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed Conceptual Domain to the RELEASED Version of Assessments in preparation of OneData. 6/18/14 EDRN content retired.  VD reused by PS&CC; kept Released jc

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics

ReferenceDocuments.name: COMMENT2002496
ReferenceDocuments.description: Valid value 0-120, 999. Record the age (in years) at which each of the participant's first degree blood relatives were diagnosed with cancer. If a given relative was diagnosed with more than one cancer, each cancer diagnosis and age should be collected as a unique record.

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/13/14 CDE not retired with EDRN content; reused by other contexts. jc
